playn.core

Interface SurfaceImage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Image
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SurfaceImageGL

    public interface SurfaceImage
extends Image
    An image that provides a Surface into which you can render. Surface images are backed by textures in the GL backends and rendering goes directly to the texture.

    NOTE: currently it is not possible to draw a surface image into a Canvas on the GL backends, even though the API makes it possible. At some point we can implement the code to download the texture image from the GPU and draw it into the CPU-memory bitmap that underlies a Canvas and this will become supported.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface playn.core.Image

        Image.BitmapTransformer, Image.Region

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Destroys the texture underlying this surface image and frees up the associated GPU memory.
      Surface surface()
      Returns an interface that can be used to draw into this image.

      • Methods inherited from interface playn.core.Image

        addCallback, clearTexture, ensureTexture, getRgb, height, isReady, repeatX, repeatY, scale, setMipmapped, setRepeat, subImage, toPattern, transform, width

    • Method Detail

      • surface

        Surface surface()
        Returns an interface that can be used to draw into this image.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Destroys the texture underlying this surface image and frees up the associated GPU memory. This will happen automatically when this image is garbage collected, but this can ensure that the memory is freed at a predictable time. Warning: if you destroy a surface image that is currently being displayed by an image layer, bad things will happen. Don't do that.
